Content:
just finished the rewriting of the addressgen part. It now will take information for each coin on different servers, this will be done via a params table that will know which user/host the command need to execute remotely the requests, for some this will be done via RPC(mostly eth)
This will allow to add any number of coin as it is now possible to spread them across multiple servers.

Author: Deleted User#0000

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Separating the ui logic from the PP one will make it possible to have a lot of possibilities for future development.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (Mainly via api for security reasons, by default only the PP server will have the possibility to have a direct access to the db)

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Everything else will rely on api to get stuff done

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
about handling specific case, made minor changes to status, in case of an addy gen problem, depending on the side that didn't have its address generated, there will be a different status code : 

# BOTH EMPTY : 210
# SRC MISSING : 200
# DST MISSING : 205
# BOTH OK : 3

A specific script will then loop on  200 210 and 205 to check availability on a 5 min timeframe, as soon as the coin is back, it will try only the coin that is missing. if succeed : go to status 3 (BOTH OK) and back to the main path

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: as coin servers will be automated, the cron timebase will have to be greater than the autocheck/relaunch to avoid unnecessary calls

Content: looked at how it could be done to support ERC tokens, found a way using etherscan API for example, registered there and created an API key, very easy to get the balance. My problem now is that the contract stuff need to be done and encoded on the data fieldof eth_sendtransaction, but I don't know how to do this yet. I think it will take a bit of time for me to be able to generate this field (which will mean supporting ERC tokens). Unfortunately, every info I gathered was focused on handling tokens via GUI, not much info for curl/cli.

Content: As this part may be time consuming, I will just skip it until I found a way to build the data field.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
The scripts are not komodo specific, they are using any coin cli to make it possible. Coins like ETH, (I really hope I'll be able to integrate it) will also be integrated. In fact any coin having a CLI could theorically be integrated, without any scaling issue as they can sit on multiple servers.

The thing is : It will make every KMD AC easier to buy/trade, and will at the same time be useful to any trader that want to be recognized as trustworthy (A reputation system is planned).

With current "tech", we can't say it's KMD "powered", but if this project is successful and people like the concept maybe in the future there will be a possibility to use different method and get rid of infrastructure, or the project may also go on a totally different way and just develop an exchange feature

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: any new KMD assetchain will be exchangeable natively on the platform, this point may also help motivate devs to choose to create assetchain on KMD, or migrate their existing token into a KMD AC.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Obviously, Barterlly alone won't be the reason people would choose to use kmd tech instead of something else, but at least it will be a brand new tool that didn't exist before.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: thanks for the explanation, you make really good points üòÉ

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I believe this is only a first step, this will allow us to see if there is a real real demand and market for it, and if we can catch it
